name: Crouzeix's conjecture
rephrased: For any square complex matrix A and any complex polynomial p, the operator norm of p(A) is bounded by twice the maximum value that |p(z)| takes on the numerical range W(A) of A.
implication_form: If A is a square complex matrix and p is a complex polynomial, then ||p(A)|| ≤ 2 * sup_{z∈W(A)} |p(z)|.
explained: Crouze's conjecture states that for any square complex matrix \(A\) and any complex polynomial \(p\), the matrix norm of \(p(A)\) is bounded by twice the maximum value of \(|p(z)|\) for \(z\) in the numerical range \(W(A)\) of \(A\). This is expressed as \(\|p(A)\| \leq 2 \sup_{z \in W(A)} |p(z)|\). This inequality is conjectured to hold for all square complex matrices \(A\) and all complex polynomials \(p\), although it remains unproven.

terms.name: Matrix Norm
terms.definition: A function assigning a scalar to a matrix that quantifies its size; common examples include the operator norm and the Frobenius norm.

terms.name: Polynomial on Matrices
terms.definition: The evaluation of a polynomial at a matrix, defined recursively by \(p(A) = c_0 I + c_1 A + c_2 A^2 + \dots + c_n A^n\) for a polynomial \(p(z) = c_0 + c_1 z + \dots + c_n z^n\).

terms.name: Numerical Range
terms.definition: The set \(W(A) = \{ \langle Ax, x \rangle \mid \|x\| = 1 \}\), where \(\langle \cdot, \cdot \rangle\) denotes the standard complex inner product and \(\|\cdot\|\) the associated norm. Also known as the field of values.

related_conjectures: The 4/3 conjecture (by Bhatia and Mondal), which proposes \(\|p(A)\| \leq \frac{4}{3} \sup_{z \in W(A)} |p(z)|\) and is weaker than Crouzeix's conjecture.
Bounds on the numerical radius and operator norms involving polynomials evaluated on matrices.
